tourName: Chitwan luxury tiger safari in Nepal
generalInfo:
Introduction:
This luxury Chitwan tiger safari holiday is a great way of exploring this incredible park and go in search of wildlife such as tigers, rhinos, elephants and other species. Nepal and in particular Chitwan is one of the few places in the world where you can track tigers on foot and indeed we encounter more tigers in the regions of Chitwan National Parks on foot than anywhere else on Earth.

Chitwan is a combination of jungle, sal forest, grassland and river systems all of which are ideal habitat for tiger as well as many other mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish. This makes the park one of the greatest wildlife watching locations in the world.

The itinerary below is for Chitwan National Park and uses some of the best lodges in the area. These lodges are not just beautiful and luxury, but also massively invest into the local communities surrounding the park.

All of our tiger safaris are guided by a zoologist (where available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) as well as local naturalist guides, drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible. This not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits. We are proud of the fact that we have a 75% success of spotting tigers in Nepal, with a 60% success in spotting them on foot whilst tracking tigers in Chitwan or Bardia. The fitness level required for our tiger safaris, is a moderate level of walking in Nepal (as tiger tracking on foot through the forests and grasslands can last for 7-8 hours).

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner where mentioned. There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides. The guides have spent years in Nepal (and in particular Chitwan) and know the places and wildlife and local villages. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide- zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).


Best time to go on a tiger safari in Nepal:

For tiger watching in Nepal we recommend mid January to mid May which is the middle and end of the hot dry season when wildlife gather at waterholes.

Why choose this tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced local naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (please check the availability of our specialist zoologists for this trip when enquiring) that escorts all our safaris has great experience working with and studying wild animals all over the world and has experience in working with big cats (particularly Tigers) in the Indian Subcontinent and elsewhere in the world.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Bhutan in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Chitwan Luxury Tiger Safari Holiday a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Nepal which explore other areas and focus on other species such as Jungle cats and Red pandas as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari. We are also experts in organising treks in the Nepalese Himalayas.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).
• We also contribute to Tour Operators for Tigers (TOFT) which is an NGO in the the Indian Subcontinent which is dedicated the sustainable and eco friendly future of tiger tourism.

Locations:

This tour explores the massive and famous national park of Chitwan in southern Nepal. The entry and exit port of this tour is the wonderful and iconic city of Kathmandu.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Luxury Chitwan Safari wildlife holiday is relatively high. This is because we include jungle hikes, these are either full days (7-8 hours) or half days (3-4 hours) inside the park hiking. The terrain is rough and the heat can be very hot and fatiguing. There are also dangerous animals around (such as rhinos and elephants) and on rare occasions evasive action is needed to avoid these animals.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights.

Minimum Age: 18 Years Old

dayInfo.description: Kathmandu - On your arrival into Kathmandu airport, you will be met by your local guide/driver and transferred to your accommodation (Dwarikas Hotel). After checking in and if your flight arrived in the morning you can be taken out with a local guide to enjoy some sightseeing around this historic city; we will look to visit Swayambunath, Boudnath Stupa and Durbar Square and then we will head back to the accommodation for your first night in Kathmandu. (no meals included today).

Chitwan National Park - After breakfast in Kathmandu you will be picked up from the hotel and transferred to the domestic airport terminal to catch your flight from Kathmandu to Bharatpur. Once you arrive you will be collected and take to your accommodation on the border of Chiwan. Chitwan is 932km sq of protected forest, grassland and waterways called Chitwan National Park. On arrival at your lodge (Sapana Village Lodge) you will check in and then have an afternoon trip to the local village for a short village tour around one of the Tharu villages here. (breakfast and dinner included today)

Chitwan National Park - After breakfast at the lodge you will be transferred from Sapana Village Lodge towards your next lodge. Unlike Sapana Village Lodge which is located nearby the busy village of Suaraha the next lodge Temple Tiger Lodge, is located right on the border of the buffer zone to the park. In the afternoon you will enter the park, most likely in a jeep safari. (Breakfast and dinner included today).

Chitwan National Park / Kathmandu - This morning is your last excursion into the park. After this and your breakfast you will be taken back to the town of Bharatpur in time to catch your flight back to Kathmandu. The rest of the day (on arrival back in Dwarikas in Kathmandu) is free for you to rest and relax. (Breakfast only).
Home - Today you will be taken to the airport from your hotel in time to catch your return flight home. (Breakfast only)
